text: Ahh efinancialcareers, perhaps _the_ worst "journalism" in the finance industry. I recall licensing is silly expensive, and their free licenses used to have some restrictions (time limit and performance-based I think?). Not sure if the latter is still the case. Also, that article is total BS :joy:

text:
I'm currently using bflw/flumine. But was wondering if something like redis would help with analysis.

For example, if I wanted to query the average trading range of prices, the prior day before a race, would Redis be better than just pumping the files through BFLW and getting the results using plain Python code?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text:
I'm currently using bflw/flumine. But was wondering if something like redis would help with analysis.

For example, if I wanted to query the average trading range of prices, the prior day before a race, would Redis be better than just pumping the files through BFLW and getting the results using plain Python code?

text: the range is simple no need for redis right, to calculate waps for any defined period maybe a different story

text: I've got code that could calculate waps simply. It just uses linked lists to track traded volumes over time windows.

text: But perhaps any overhead in learning/implementing redis would be more costly than the benefits of using it. It's good to have all your code in one place. If I have separate analytical code, it could double up my chances of errors.

text: I think this is the document to  read: <https://www.betfair.com/aboutUs/Sportsbook.Rules.And.Regulations/>

attachments.text: Sign up for a £30 FREE bet with Betfair. Cash Out your In-Play bets, place a Multiple and get the best value. We also offer Games, Poker, Bingo and Casino. Bet & Win now.
attachments.fallback: Sign up for a £30 FREE bet with Betfair. Cash Out your In-Play bets, place a Multiple and get the best value. We also offer Games, Poker, Bingo and Casino. Bet & Win now.

elements.text: I think this is the document to  read:

text: "If a match is tied and the official competition rules do not determine a winner, bets on the outright result will be void unless the outcome is settled by a bowl off or super over (in which case the result of the bowl off or super over will stand for match betting). If the competition rules determine the winner by the toss of a coin, drawing of lots or higher seeding resulting from a previous round then bets will be void."

elements.text: "If a match is tied and the official competition rules do not determine a winner, bets on the outright result will be void unless the outcome is settled by a bowl off or super over (in which case the result of the bowl off or super over will stand for match betting). If the competition rules determine the winner by the toss of a coin, drawing of lots or higher seeding resulting from a previous round then bets will be void."
